intro: Ixora richardi-longii, commonly known as the red ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red inflorescences that bloom throughout the year. The plant has opposite, simple, and ovate leaves that are glossy and dark green. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Ixora richardi-longii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its showy flowers and adaptability to various garden settings.
